module.name: LCLClasses
module.short: Defines the base class for all LCL TComponents including controls

element.name: TLCLComponent
element.short: The base class for LCL components associated with widgets.

element.name: TLCLComponent.WidgetSetClass
element.short: The widget for this component is derived from WidgetSetClass.

element.name: TLCLComponent.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers this component class with the current WidgetSet.

element.name: TLCLComponent.GetWSComponentClass
element.short: This method allows descendents to override the WidgetSetClass.

element.name: TLCLComponent.NewInstance
element.short: Registers the class and initializes WidgetSetClass.

element.name: TLCLComponent.RemoveAllHandlersOfObject
element.short: Override this method to remove all references to notification handlers in AnObject.
element.descr: An override is required as soon as a component allows to add notification handlers. Then all such handlers must be removed, when their owner (AnObject) is destroyed.

element.name: TLCLComponent.RemoveAllHandlersOfObject.AnObject
element.short: The object whose handlers shall be removed.

element.name: TLCLComponent.LCLRefCount
element.short: The number of references to this component.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent
element.short: Base class for all components having an associated widget.

descr.p: The widget is created by the LCL control whenever required, and its reference is stored in FReferencePtr. This reference is for internal use by the LCL control, not by application code.
This reference is different from the OS/window manager specific window Handle.
Applications only can send messages to a windowed control, using its window Handle.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.FReferencePtr
element.short: Pointer to a widget class Reference.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.FCreating
element.short: Set while we are creating the Reference.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.GetReferenceAllocated
element.short: Checks for a valid widget reference.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.CreateParams
element.short: Override this method to supply specific widget creation parameters.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.CreateParams.AParams
element.short: The parameter record to update.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.DestroyReference
element.short: Destroys the reference object.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.GetReferenceHandle
element.short: Override this method to return the Handle from the reference

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceCreated
element.short: Called after the Reference is created.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceDestroying
element.short: Called before the Reference is destroyed

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceNeeded
element.short: Creates a Reference, if not already done.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.WSCreateReference
element.short: Tells the widgetset to create a Reference.
element.descr: This implementation returns Nil, should be overriden in every derived class.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.WSDestroyReference
element.short: Tells the widgetset to destroy the Reference.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.Handle
element.short: Get the Handle of this component.
element.descr: The Handle is sort of pointer or reference, allocated by the operating system or widgetset to this component. A window handle can be used for sending messages to the component.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceAllocated
element.short: If True, a Reference has been allocated for this component.
